column1: Paramonga is a town in central Peru
column2: capital of the district of Paramonga in the province of Barranca in the Department of Lima.

column1: The word paramonga comes from the Mochica language spoken by the people that lived in the north coast
column3: who settled in the Fortaleza Valley. Its meaning is the following:

column1: monga (here)The translation would be "vassals from around here".
If the thesis of Torero were accepted
column2: supporting that the Quechua language arose here
column3: "paramonga" would come from para = rain and munqa = verbal ending of occurrence
